content: On October 11, 1992, the Atlanta Braves faced the Pittsburgh Pirates in Game 7 of the National League Championship Series. The Braves emerged victorious with a dramatic 1-0 win, thanks to a clutch home run by Francisco Cabrera in the bottom of the ninth inning. This moment not only secured Atlanta's place in the World Series but also marked a pivotal point in the franchise's run of success in the 1990s. The game is remembered for its intense atmosphere and the iconic call by Braves broadcaster Jim Powell.
